channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Microsoft's AI Story Is Getting Complicated
item.description: Blowout capital spending, financial reporting changes and the relationship with OpenAI are making investors think twice.

item.title: ‘I don’t want to spend my remaining days living hand to mouth’: I divorced my husband and remarried. Can I claim his Social Security?
item.description: “I hope that it doesn’t trigger my ex-husband. He has a short fuse.”

item.title: The True Cost of Losing Your Home in a Hurricane (After Insurance)
item.description: Storms need only minutes to devastate people’s finances. Even residents with decent insurance and government support need years to recover.

item.title: ‘We didn’t sign an exclusive listing’: A realtor said she’d take out an ad to rent my New York City apartment. Am I morally obligated to use her?
item.description: “Other agents know our apartment is available for rent and now want to show it.”

item.title: Third-quarter earnings are upon us. So are worries of slower growth.
item.description: This summer, restaurants and many retailers who weren’t Walmart warned of a struggling consumer.

item.title: Corporate Insiders Are Sitting Out the 2024 Stock-Market Rally
item.description: Warren Buffett, Jamie Dimon and Jeff Bezos are among the business leaders exhibiting caution.

item.title: Stock Funds Gained 16.1% Through Third Quarter
item.description: Bond funds stood proud, as well, drawing investors’ cash. Also: A flashback to 95 years ago, the Great Crash.

item.title: ‘This money is not bringing me a lot of happiness’: My husband and I have $7 million, but our kids are trouble. Should we cut them off?
item.description: “His son and his wife are not good to us. We rarely see them and they never offer to help us with anything.”

item.title: What Trading Volume Is Telling Investors About the Stock Market
item.description: Investors who follow price movements along with spikes or dips in share volume can glean information about indexes’ or stocks’ direction

item.title: ‘I’m scared to death’: My wife asked for a divorce after 21 years. She wants to buy a house with our savings, but promises to help pay my mortgage.
item.description: “There is more than enough money in the savings to completely pay off the current mortgage.”
